alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 22 at 7:45AM MDT until August 23 at 10:41AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River Below Acme affecting Chaves County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring. This approaches or surpassed the flood of record. * WHERE...Pecos River below Acme. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, inundation of low laying areas occurs over mostly range land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM MDT Monday the stage was 14.06 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 AM MDT Monday was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain at a crest of 14.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.7 feet on 09/23/1941. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Pecos River Acme 13.0 13.8 Mon 6 am MDT 9.7 4.3 4.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this afternoon around 300 PM MDT.
